TopicTitle: TV shows about going back to the moon.

Articles.Content:
So I just watch "For all Mankind" season one, and it made me remember seeing a trailer for something else I cannot find now. Help!

All I remember from the trailer was an apollo-esque lander performing a 'routine' landing at a moon base or something, in front of a camera already set up. When they touch down, the two astronauts groan as they release advertising banners on the outside of the craft for the world to see over the camera.

That's all I remember. Does anyone know if this was a show, or a movie, or just some silly commercial for something?

It looks like the opening of Iron Sky, which is a really fun movie about pedants on the dark side of the moon. But it does not have much to do with an actual or hypothetical mission back to Moon (except that it starts with one).

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1034314/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0

Ah, thank you. I had seen iron sky pop up in my searches, but I hadn't even considered watching the trailer as it seemed so ridiculous. Still though, a fun sequence to rewatch. Thank you  for the sleuthing!
Yeah, it's a fun documentary about pedants on the dark side of the moon. The sequel isn't worth the time to watch it though (just watch the trailers, you'll have the most interesting parts).

On 8/11/2020 at 7:20 AM, Okhin said:

Yeah, it's a fun documentary about pedants on the dark side of the moon. The sequel isn't worth the time to watch it though (just watch the trailers, you'll have the most interesting parts).

seeing space hitler riding a dinasaur made it worth it.
